result.execSummary:
The defendant Clifford Beasley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Robbery of a Financial Institution [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.87.
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to any other sentence. Credit for 178 days time served.

superMiscConds.notes:
CONDITIONS AS TO CTS 1-4:
Cooperate with any and all rules set forth by the probation agent.  Participate in Cognitive Thinking program.

Referral to Mental health division for mental assessment and if necessary, successfully complete follow-up treatment. Take any medication prescribed only in the manner/dosage as prescribed by treating physician.
Obtain AODA assessment and successfully complete follow-up treatment. Cooperate with random urine screens.

No drug dealing or association with drug community (drug users/dealers or drug houses). No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause. No contact with victims John L., Ashley F., Tiffany J., Jabalja L., Shelina H., Paul H., Debra A., and Community Financial Service Center located at 2652 W. Fond du Lac Ave.
Obtain/maintain full time employment or full time school and part time employment.
Pay all supervision fees. Provide DNA sample- pay surcharge. Pay all mandatory applicable surcharges, fees, assessments, and costs.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

supervisions.notes: CTS 1-4: Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program only after serving the first 5 years of these sentences.

Court ordered that all financial obligations and restitution be paid through collection of sums by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #3

Defendant Clifford Beasley in court with attorney Thomas John Erickson.  Defendant Clifford Beasley in custody.  Benjamin A. Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

CASE RECALLED AT THE REQUEST OF THE COURT.......

In chambers conference held with both counsel off the record prior to case being recalled.  On the Court's own motion, the Court modifies sentence as follows:

AS TO COUNT 1:  The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 6 YEARS, CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence with credit for 178 days served. The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 4 YEARS.  The MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION IS 2 YEARS.

AS TO COUNT 2:  The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 4 YEARS, CONCURRENT to Count 3, CONSECUTIVE to Counts 1, 4, and any other sentence with credit for 0 days served. The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS.  The MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION IS 2 YEARS.

AS TO COUNT 3:  The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 2 YEARS, CONCURRENT to Count 2, CONSECUTIVE to Counts 1, 4, and any other sentence with credit for 0 days served. The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR.  The MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION IS 1 YEAR.

AS TO COUNT 4: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 3 YEARS, CONSECUTIVE to Counts 1, 2, 3 and with any other sentence with credit for 0 days served. The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS.  The MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION IS 1 YEAR.

No objection from the state.  The Court ordered the no contact order as to victim in Count 5, Paul H. MODIFIED to reflect the correct name of William H.  No objection from defense.

*All other orders made during plea and sentencing hearing held earlier this date remains the same*  Filed, Amended Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence- copy to defendant.
filed.

Matter before the court for Doctor's Report Return. Bail remains as previously set prior to proceedings being suspended (10,000 cash w/ tot JusticePoint).  Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.  
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.
